	Supervise Warehouse Operations and Inventory Management

	Conduct regular stock audits and reconciliations in line with internal control procedures.

	Maintain a vetted list of pre-qualified vendors with up-to-date KYC documentation including CAC certificates, tax ID, and proof of insurance.
	Negotiate transportation rates and service agreements in line with company cost and efficiency targets.
	Continuously evaluate vendor performance using delivery timelines, cost efficiency, and customer satisfaction indicators.

	Inventory planning and tracking expertise.
	Familiar with import/export and customs processes (where applicable).

	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (especially Excel).
	Working Knowledge of ERP programmes.


Behavioral skills:

	Strong leadership and supervisory capabilities.
	Proactive, reliable, and capable of working under pressure.
	Strong ethical standards and commitment to compliance.

Feed Avenue operates in import, formulation and distribution processes of premixes and ingredients essential for animal nutrition (Poultry, Swine, Cattle, Fish, Horse and small ruminants). Our mission: Bring to livestock farmers in Nigeria the guarantee of a unique quality of natural performing products and expertise. Thanks to our team of veterinarians, nutritionists and technicians, we offer to our customers the commitment of personnalized advisory support in the formulation of food, and continuous improvement of the nutritional quality of premix, additives, mineral foods and nutritional specialties tailor-made for the animal sector in Nigeria. We operate over a large part of the Nigerian territory thanks to our regional team. We act responsibly and are committed to our Corporate Social Responsibility.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse & Logistics Manager

Job Locations: Lagos and Magboro - Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Missions & Activities
Main Missions:


	Supervise Warehouse Operations and Inventory Management
	Coordinate Logistics and Delivery Operations
	Vendor Management and KYC Documentation
	Reporting and Administrative Oversight

Supervise Warehouse Operations and Inventory Management:


	Oversee, supervise, and coordinate all warehouse operations, including inventory control and stock integrity.
	Ensure goods received and dispatched are properly recorded, labeled, and sealed.
	Approve and monitor inventory levels and stock movement between locations or third-party warehouses.
	Enforce strict hygiene, safety, and security standards in all warehouse operations.
	Conduct regular stock audits and reconciliations in line with internal control procedures.
	Maintain structured filing systems for inventory reports, receipts, and delivery notes.


Coordinate Local Logistics and Delivery Operations:


	Plan and schedule all deliveries in coordination with the sales and finance teams.
	Monitor performance of delivery operations, including third-party transporters and in-house vehicles
	Resolve delivery-related challenges including route delays, failed deliveries, and emergency supply chain disruptions.
	Ensure full compliance with statutory and regulatory transportation requirements within Nigeria.


Vendor Management and KYC Documentation:


	Identify and onboard competent logistics vendors across various categories (haulage, courier, LTL/FTL).
	Maintain a vetted list of pre-qualified vendors with up-to-date KYC documentation including CAC certificates, tax ID, and proof of insurance.
	Negotiate transportation rates and service agreements in line with company cost and efficiency targets.
	Continuously evaluate vendor performance using delivery timelines, cost efficiency, and customer satisfaction indicators.


Reporting and Administrative Oversight:


	Provide weekly and monthly reports on stock movement, delivery timelines, vendor performance, and associated logistics costs.
	Recommend improvements to warehousing and distribution systems based on trends and insights.
	Collaborate with sales and procurement to forecast logistics needs and plan accordingly.
	Maintain accurate and timely communication with all internal departments regarding logistics schedules and issues.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's / Master's Degree with 10 - 15 years of work experience.


Skills required for the position
Theoretical and practical knowledge:


	Strong understanding of warehousing, supply chain, and logistics management within the Nigerian operating context.
	Familiarity with transportation networks, logistics vendor markets, and regulatory compliance.
	Inventory planning and tracking expertise.
	Familiar with import/export and customs processes (where applicable).
	Excellent communication and vendor negotiation skills.


Technical and methodological know-how:


	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office tools (especially Excel).
	Working Knowledge of ERP programmes.


Behavioral skills:


	Highly organised and detail-oriented.
	Strong leadership and supervisory capabilities.
	Proactive, reliable, and capable of working under pressure.
	Strong ethical standards and commitment to compliance.

Call Centre Representative Job at ITC Worldwide




        
    

        
        ITC Worldwide offers Microsoft Experienced & Certifiedcomprehensive technical and functional support Services for all Microsoft enterprise technologies, including Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft 365 across the cloud, hybrid, and on-premises. Includes around the clock problem resolution, proactive advisory services, onsite support, and add-on services to customize your support experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Centre Representative
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a customer-focused and solution-oriented Call Center Representative to join our growing support team.
	In this role, you will serve as the first point of contact for our customers, handling inquiries, resolving issues, and delivering an exceptional customer experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Handle incoming calls, chats, or emails from customers and provide accurate, satisfactory answers to their queries or concerns.
	Resolve customer complaints efficiently and escalate issues when necessary.
	Maintain a positive, empathetic, and professional attitude toward customers at all times.
	Update customer records in the system and track interactions in the CRM.
	Collaborate with internal departments to find solutions to customer problems.
	Meet performance goals such as response time, call handling, and customer satisfaction metrics.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in any relevant field (required).
	Minimum of 12 years of experience in a call center or customer service role.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving and organizational abilities.
	Proficient in using customer support software and CRM tools.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends or shifts, if required.

Procurement Officer Job at Proforce Limited




        
    

        
        Proforce Limited was incorporated in 2008 as a total defence solution provider specializing in armoured vehicles and personal protection. The company’s focus is on the delivery of confidence in protective mobility. We have developed a vibrant market for security and mobile protective products within Nigeria and Africa. PROFORCE has exploited its deep technical know-how to produce outstanding armored products for Government Agencies, Corporate Bodies, Diplomatic Communities and Private individuals within Nigeria and Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Ode Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description


	The Procurement Officer is responsible for sourcing and purchasing materials, equipment, and services essential for the company's production activities.
	The role requires strong negotiation skills, market awareness, and the ability to manage supplier relationships to ensure cost-effective and timely procurement in line with company policies and quality standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and procure raw materials, equipment, and services in line with production requirements.
	Evaluate and negotiate contracts with suppliers to secure advantageous terms.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential vendors.
	Monitor inventory levels and forecast procurement needs to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and relevant regulatory requirements.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings and value improvements in the supply chain.
	Ensure timely delivery of goods and services to support uninterrupted production operations.
	Prepare and process purchase orders, requisitions, and other procurement documentation.
	Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness.
	Collaborate with finance, production, and warehouse teams to align procurement activities.


Job Requirements
Education & Qualifications:


	B.Sc. / HND in Purchasing and Supply, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related disciplines.
	Membership of a relevant professional body (e.g., CIPS, CIPSMN) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	3 - 5 years of proven experience as a Procurement Officer, preferably within the manufacturing sector.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong negotiation and communication skills.
	Good knowledge of supply chain procedures and procurement best practices.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) and procurement software.
	Strong analytical and organizational skills.
	Good understanding of contract terms and risk management.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Strong attention to detail and integrity.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: hrm@proforcedefence.com using the Job Position "Procurement Officer" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
